pull.title: qa: Initialize lockstack to prevent null pointer deref
pull.body:
It is currently impossible to call debug methods such as `AssertLock(Not)Held` on a thread without running into undefined behavior, unless a lock was pushed on the stack in this thread.

Initializing the global `lockstack` seems to fix both issues.

events.body: Nice, thanks for this fix. I don't feel qualified to review the code change itself. But, I did verify that the patch appears to fix #13263 for me too. Thanks!
If it's a static variable initialized at startup, maybe do away with the pointer?

@Empact that should work but maybe consider this patch as a "fix". Also keeping it as a smart pointer is more flexible IMO.

utACK fa6a9b5.

tree 9aad64e50a0e1522818eb9c2576670be48b7611f
parent d792e47421fcb9ce3b381c1e6d8902777ae3f9f3
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1526952947 -0400
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1526985086 -0400

qa: Initialize lockstack to prevent null pointer deref

events.message: qa: Initialize lockstack to prevent null pointer deref

events.body: utACK fa9da85, statically allocated does look better. Not sure about the new variable name - is a static variable also global?
@promag My rule of thumb is "everything is a global unless it is a class member". Couldn't yet find any issues with that rule :p

Thread-local is a very special kind of global, but as for variable naming it's fine, it has global *scope* from the perspective of the compiler.

utACK fa9da85b7cc759d06bc24854be2bad0ea87b6006

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13295

qa: Initialize lockstack to prevent null pointer deref

Qt: use [default wallet] as name for wallet with no name
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13275

issue.title: memory: Construct globals on first use
issue.body:
The (de)initialization order is not well defined in C++, so generally it is not safe to use globals as the (de/con)structor of one global could use the (de/con)structor of another global before/after it has been (con/de)structed.


Specifically this fixes:
* `g_logger` might not be initialized on the first use, so do that. (Fixes #15111)

issue.title: Sync backports
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8392
  - We cherry-picked the second commit in zcash/zcash#2812.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9535
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9674
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9987
  - Excluding code that is still in use for us.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11432
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10866
  - Excluding the third commit (we don't have the code it alters).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11722
- bitcoin/bitcoin#12283
  - Only the typos we currently have.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#12367
  - Only the first commit, which fixes a bug in bitcoin/bitcoin#8392.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#12891
  - Only the first commit (the linter is useless for our logging system).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#13236
- bitcoin/bitcoin#13300
- bitcoin/bitcoin#13423
  - Only the first commit (second commit blocks on net processing refactors).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11640
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11599
- bitcoin/bitcoin#14963
  - Only the first and third commits.
